sen.j: 田代 栄助（たしろ えいすけ、天保5年8月14日 (旧暦)（1834年9月16日） - 明治18年（1885年）5月17日）は江戸時代から明治時代にかけての侠客。
sen.e: Eisuke TASHIRO (September 16, 1834 - May 17, 1885) was a kyokaku (professional gambler) during the time between the Meiji period and the Edo period.
Eisuke TASHIRO (September 16, 1834 - May 17, 1885) was a kyokaku (professional gambler) over the Edo and Meiji periods.
sen.cmt: during the time between the Meiji period and the Edo period --> over the Edo and Meiji periods
sen.e: Eisuke TASHIRO (September 16, 1834 - May 17, 1885) was a kyokaku (professional gambler) over the Edo and Meiji periods.

sen.j: 秩父事件では困民党の総理として蜂起を指揮した。
sen.e: He led the uprising of the Chichibu Incident as the head of the Konminto Party.
He led the uprising of the Chichibu Incident as the head of the Konminto Party.
He led the uprising of the Chichibu Incident as the head of the Konminto Party.
Yoshihiro SOMA (相馬義広) was his false name.
Yoshihiro SOMA (相馬義広) was his false name.
Yoshihiro SOMA (相馬義広) was his false name.

sen.j: 田代勇太郎嘉之の子として武蔵国秩父郡大宮郷字熊木（現・埼玉県秩父市熊木町）に生まれる。
sen.e: He was born the son of Yutaro Yoshiyuki TASHIRO (田代勇太郎嘉之) in Aza Kumaki, Omiyago, Chichibu District, Musashi Province (present Kumaki-cho, Chichibu City, Saitama Prefecture).
sen.cmt: 田代勇太郎嘉之の読み不明熊木<http://homepage1.nifty.com/joichi/2-3ki.html>
sen.e: He was born as a son of Yutaro Yoshiyuki TASHIRO (田代勇太郎嘉之) in Aza Kumaki, Omiyago, Chichibu District, Musashi Province (present Kumaki-cho, Chichibu City, Saitama Prefecture).
sen.cmt: born the son of --> born as a son of
sen.e: He was born as a son of Yutaro Yoshiyuki TASHIRO (田代勇太郎嘉之) in Aza Kumaki, Omiyago, Chichibu District, Musashi Province (present Kumaki-cho, Chichibu City, Saitama Prefecture).

sen.j: 実家は江戸時代に忍藩の割役名主を務めたこともある名家であった。
sen.e: His parental home was an important family which had served as a wariyaku nanushi (representative of village headmen) for the Oshi Domain in the Edo period.
His family home was an important family which had served as a wariyaku nanushi (representative of village headmen) for the Oshi Domain in the Edo period.
His family home was an important family which had served as a wariyaku nanushi (representative of village headmen) for the Oshi Domain in the Edo period.

sen.j: 農業を営むかたわら、他者の賃借などについて仲裁を行ったり、困窮者の手助けを行ったり、放浪者を救ったりするなど義侠心に厚かった。
sen.e: He had a high chivalrous sprit such as mediating other's lease issues, helping the poor and saving wanderers, while engaging in farming.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: He was so chivalrous that he would mediate people's debt problems, help the poor and save wanderers, while being engaging in farming.
He was so chivalrous that he would mediate people's debt problems, help the poor and save wanderers, while being engaging in farming.

sen.j: 秩父の郡民からは非常に信頼されており、子分と称する者は200人を越えるほどだったという。
sen.e: He was greatly trusted by the people of Chichibu District, and had more than 200 people who claimed themselves his followers.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: It is said that he was greatly trusted by the people of Chichibu District, and had more than 200 people who claimed themselves his followers.
sen.cmt: it is said構文にしました。
sen.e: It is said that he was greatly trusted by the people of Chichibu District, and had more than 200 people who claimed themselves his followers.

sen.j: しかし、明治に入ると微禄し、高利貸しから借金をするほどになっていた。
sen.e: After the Meiji period, however, he suffered from poverty and borrowed money from a loan shark.
After the Meiji period, however, he became so poor that he had to borrow money from a loan shark.
After the Meiji period, however, he became so poor that he had to borrow money from a loan shark.

sen.j: 明治17年（1884年）初頭（1月下旬から2月上旬頃）には自由党 (日本)へ加入をするが、その手続きの後に党員の村上泰治から傲慢な態度を取られたため憤慨し、その後は関わりを持っていない。
sen.e: In early 1884 (from late January to early February), he joined the Liberal Party (of Japan), but he got angry with a domineering attitude shown by a party member, Taiji MURAKAMI after the admission procedure and since then, he had never been involved in the party.

In early 1884 (from late January to early February), he joined the Liberal Party (of Japan), but he got angry with a domineering attitude shown by a party member, Taiji MURAKAMI after the entrance processing, so that he did not get involved in the party due to this incident.

In early 1884 (from late January to early February), he joined the Liberal Party (of Japan), but he got angry with a domineering attitude shown by a party member, Taiji MURAKAMI after the entrance processing, so that he did not get involved in the party due to this incident.

sen.j: 同年9月、困民党に招聘され、総理に推挙される。
sen.e: In September of the same year, he was called by the Konminto Party and recommended to be the leader.
In September of the same year, he was called on by the Konminto Party and nominated for the party leader.
sen.cmt: calledをcalled onに変更、その他表現の見直し
sen.e: In September of the same year, he was called on by the Konminto Party and nominated for the party leader.

sen.j: そして議論の末に蜂起を決定し、10月31日に蜂起を開始。
sen.e: After the discussion, he decided to rise in revolt and the uprising launched on October 31.
After the discussion, he decided to rise in revolt and launched the uprising on October 31.
sen.cmt: the uprising launched --> launched the uprising
sen.e: After the discussion, he decided to rise in revolt and launched the uprising on October 31.

sen.j: だが11月3日に持病の胸痛を起こしたため指揮系統から外れ、翌4日には本陣を離脱。
sen.e: However, he was removed from the chain of command because he had a chest pain, his chronic disease on November 3 and then left the headquarters on the following day of November 4.
However, he was removed from the chain of command because he had a chest pain, his chronic disease on November 3 and then left the headquarters on the following day of November 4.
However, he was removed from the chain of command because he had a chest pain, his chronic disease on November 3 and then left the headquarters on the following day of November 4.

sen.j: その後逃避して11月11日まで山に籠もり、11月14日に黒谷村（後に原谷村 (埼玉県)、現在は秩父市）の知人宅に宿泊。
sen.e: After that, he ran away, went into a mountain until November 11, and then stayed in his friend's home in Kurodani Village (later Haraya Village in Saitama Prefecture, and present Chichibu City).
After that, he ran away, went into a mountain until November 11, and then stayed in his friend's home in Kurodani Village (later Haraya Village in Saitama Prefecture, and present Chichibu City).
After that, he ran away, went into a mountain until November 11, and then stayed in his friend's home in Kurodani Village (later Haraya Village in Saitama Prefecture, and present Chichibu City).

sen.j: しかしその家の下働きの老女に密告され、翌15日未明、就寝していたところを警官隊に踏み込まれて捕縛された。
sen.e: He was, however, betrayed by an old woman servant at the home and arrested by police raided on the home before dawn on November 15 while asleep in bed.
He was, however, betrayed by an old woman servant at the home and arrested by the police before dawn on November 15 while being asleep in bed.
sen.cmt: by police raided on the home before dawn on November 15 while asleep --> by the police before dawn on November 15 while being asleep
sen.e: He was, however, betrayed by an old woman servant at the home and arrested by the police before dawn on November 15 while being asleep in bed.

sen.j: その後取り調べを経て、明治18年（1885年）2月19日に死刑判決を受ける。
sen.e: After that, he was questioned and sentenced to death penalty on February 19, 1885.
After that, he was questioned and sentenced to death penalty on February 19, 1885.
After that, he was questioned and sentenced to death penalty on February 19, 1885.

sen.j: 同年5月17日、加藤織平・新井周三郎・高岸善吉・坂本宗作と共に絞首刑。
sen.e: He was executed by hanging along with Orihei KATO, Shuzaburo ARAI, Zenkichi TAKAGISHI and Sosaku SAKAMOTO on May 17 of the same year.
sen.cmt: 加藤織平<http://kotobank.jp/word/%E5%8A%A0%E8%97%A4%E7%B9%94%E5%B9%B3>新井周三郎<http://kotobank.jp/word/%E6%96%B0%E4%BA%95%E5%91%A8%E4%B8%89%E9%83%8E>高岸善吉<http://kids.gakken.co.jp/box/syakai/06/pdf/B026111120.pdf>坂本宗作<http://www.geocities.co.jp/Hollywood-Cinema/5784/honbun/sa4.html>
sen.e: He was executed by hanging along with Orihei KATO, Shuzaburo ARAI, Zenkichi TAKAGISHI and Sosaku SAKAMOTO on May 17 of the same year.
He was executed by hanging along with Orihei KATO, Shuzaburo ARAI, Zenkichi TAKAGISHI and Sosaku SAKAMOTO on May 17 of the same year.
He was 52 years old.
He was 52 years old.
He was 52 years old.

sen.j: 辞世の句は「振りかえり 見れど昨日の影もなし 行くさき暗き 死出の山道」。
sen.e: His death haiku (Japanese poem composed on the eve of his death) was: "When I swing around, Shadows of yesterday are not seen, Dark road to go is a mountain pass to death".
His death haiku (Japanese poem composed immediately before one dies) was: "When I swing around, Shadows of yesterday are not seen, Dark road to go is a mountain pass to death."
sen.cmt: Japanese poem composed on the eve of his death --> Japanese poem composed immediately before one dies
sen.e: His death haiku (Japanese poem composed immediately before one dies) was: "When I swing around, Shadows of yesterday are not seen, Dark road to go is a mountain pass to death."
